alert.note: Alert for Jackson (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 27 at 10:05AM CST until January 28 at 3:16PM CST by NWS Houston - Galveston
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Texas... Lavaca River near Edna affecting Jackson County. For the Lavaca River...including Edna...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Lavaca River near Edna. * WHEN...Until tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 25.0 feet, Moderate lowland flooding begins with the river one third of a mile wide near the Highway 59 bridge flooding secondary roads and bridges along the river. Livestock are isolated and potentially drown. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:15 AM CST Saturday the stage was 24.8 feet. - Bankfull stage is 20.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 9:15 AM CST Saturday was 25.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage late tonight and continue falling to 9.3 feet Thursday morning. - Flood stage is 21.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 24.8 feet on 08/31/1946. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (12 pm CST) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Sun Mon Tue Lavaca River Edna 21.0 24.8 Sat 9 am CST 17.8 12.6 10.7 &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening.late tonight at 415 AM CST.
